attributes.action: Prevent any further extensions to the Brexit deadline of October 31st
attributes.additional_details:
The people of the UK voted by majority to leave the EU. The Government has had 3 years to prepare for leaving and it is time to do so. 
Claims that the Government has no mandate for a No Deal exit may have some truth however the Government has no mandate for a Deal exit either, nor does it have a mandate to continue seeking extensions.
The Government simply has a mandate to get the UK out of the EU and how it does this should be left to the Government without any further delays.
attributes.background: The Government should not be allowed to seek any further extensions to the Brexit deadline of October 31st. If any new legislation is passed forcing the Government to seek a further extension then it should be disregarded. The UK will leave the European Union with or without a deal on October 31st.
